channel.title: Notes on Dang-Khoa's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on Dang-Khoa's blog

item.title: Matlab
item.description:
General

  • Show the information of a variable. It is very useful when we the code takes so much memory: whos <variable name>.
  • Sum of squared of elements: sumsqr(X). Use sum(sum(A.^2, 1)) instead of you want to use less memory.
  • Memory optimizations tips and tricks: [Undocumented Matlab]

Libraries

VLFeat

Use vl_imreadjpeg instead of imread. It could speed up reading image files.

item.title: C++
item.description:
There are some notes about cool stuff in C++, and also some crazy things.

Object Oriented Programming

/* (1) */
T object(arg);

/* (2) */
T object{arg};

(1) can be used by all types of class and non-class. In contrast, (2) is only used to initialize non-class type.
